bugs.title: RFE: Ship selinux-policy in the package

bugzilla.short_desc: RFE: Ship selinux-policy in the package

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
In order to avoid requests for changing selinux-policy package, we should pack mysql module of the SElinux policy in the server package itself. Similarly for MariaDB.
Can you please give us the current status, Jakub?

Hi, there is package mysql-selinux in f29-30 which works for both mysql and mariadb. Just adding as Requires, should work. There should land all new fixes, which are then synced with selinux-policy package.

I added macros for it in both MariaDB & MySQL.
They can be enabled by simply setting the appropriate macro on the top of the SPECfile to "1".

However for now, I leave it disabled, because of a bug in 'selinux-policy'

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-2580 mysql: InnoDB unspecified vulnerability (CPU Apr 2019)

long_desc.thetext:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent: InnoDB). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.15 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server.

External References:

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/security-advisory/cpuapr2019-5072813.html

against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as

Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent: Server: Replication). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.25 and prior and 8.0.15 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server.

External References:

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/security-advisory/cpujul2019-5072835.html

notes:
**MySQL 8.0.17**

This update brings the latest MySQL 8.0.17 which fixes severe security issues. Now available as both a standard package and a module!

Release notes:

    https://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/mysql/8.0/en/news-8-0-17.html

Mainatiner notes:

    * The MySQL Modules are now built from the same sources as the base packages, so the should be identical
    * The package is now being built with number of standard Fedora build flags that has not been used before. The package should be now more stable and secure.
    * In Modules, the bug #1729133 still exists
    * The MySQL 5.7 and 5.6 Modules may exists, but I'm out of capacity to maintain them. Whenever possible upgrade to MySQL 8.
